t: Psalm 83
Prayer against Enemies
A song. A psalm of Asaph.
God,*pn do not keep silent. Do*ln not be deaf, God; do not be quiet.
See*ln how your enemies make an uproar; those*ln who hate you have acted arrogantly.
They*ln devise clever schemes against your people; they*ln conspire against your treasured ones.
They*ln say, “Come, let’s wipe them out as a nation so*ln that Israel’s name will no longer be remembered.”
For*ln they have conspired with one mind; they*ln form an alliance against you—
the*ln tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab*ln and the Hagrites,
Gebal,*ln Ammon, and Amalek, Philistia*ln with the inhabitants of Tyre.
Even*ln Assyria has joined them; they*ln lend support to the sons of Lot. Selah*ig
Deal*pn with them as you did with Midian, as*ln you did with Sisera and*ln Jabin at the Kishon River.
They*ln were destroyed at En-dor; they*ln became manure for the ground.
Make*ln their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, and*ln all their tribal leaders like Zebah and Zalmunna,
who*ln said, “Let’s seize God’s pastures for ourselves.”
Make*pn them like tumbleweed, my God, like*ln straw before the wind.
As*ln fire burns a forest, as*ln a flame blazes through mountains,
so*ln pursue them with your tempest and*ln terrify them with your storm.
Cover*ln their faces with shame so*ln that they will seek your name, Lord.*s
Let*ln them be put to shame and terrified forever; let*ln them perish in disgrace.
May*ln they know that you alone — whose*ln name is the Lord—*s are*ln the Most High over the whole earth.
